items.sentence: You\'re not moving back to Australia, are you?
I\'ve always wanted to see if I could do that.
I\'ve asked Tom many times to stop doing that.
I\'ve been bitten by my own dog several times.
I\'ve been in Australia for less than a month.
I\'ve been in Boston way longer than you have.
I\'ve been looking for a better place to live.
Tom acted as if he didn\'t care what happened.
Tom and Mary didn\'t go to the dance together.
Tom, I found the picture you were looking for.
Tom, Mary, John and Alice are all from Boston.
Tom, Mary, John and Alice sat around the fire.
I wasn\'t aware I wasn\'t supposed to do that.
Tom is in the classroom, taking a French test.
Tom is probably buying a bus ticket right now.
Tom is reading the article you told him about.
Tom knows a few guys who work at that factory.
Why is it that you\'re always late for school?
Without Tom\'s advice, Mary would have failed.
If it rains tonight, I\'m not going to go out.
I have rather a busy afternoon in front of me.
I have to be home tonight before it gets dark.
Tom wondered if he should tell Mary the truth.
Tom worked until he was too tired to continue.
Tom was thirsty, so he drank a glass of water.
Tom was too busy to notice what was happening.
Tom was very determined to finish the project.
Tom was working as an interpreter last summer.
We\'ll discuss the problem with them tomorrow.
I wonder if Tom likes dancing as much as Mary.
Where did you get those strange-looking shoes?
Who knows more about you than your own mother?
I don\'t like him coming to my house so often.
I don\'t like his affected manner of speaking.
I\'ll fix your sink for you if you want me to.
I\'ll never forget what Tom said at that time.
Tom and three of his friends went on a picnic.
Tom asked Mary if she wanted to go to a movie.
These days, kids no longer play in the street.
I want to know when Tom began studying French.
We had many bitter experiences during the war.
Let\'s open the box and see what\'s inside it.
Tom formed a garage band called The Squirrels.
Tom found something hidden behind the dresser.
Tom found the note that Mary had left for him.
Tom got a ticket for passing on a yellow line.
Tom got into an argument with the head waiter.
Tom certainly knows more about this than I do.
Tom checked his watch to see what time it was.
Tom checks his email before he eats breakfast.
